questions.question_text: Stakeholders are only allowed to meet with the Scrum Team at Sprint Review.
questions.answer_description:
Getting feedback from Stakeholders is a crucial activity in Scrum. Working with stakeholders frequently ensures the team to focus on the right things to build.
Although it is required to have Stakeholders at Sprint Review, they can also engage with the Scrum Team during Product Backlog Refinement, Sprint Planning or during the Sprint if the Scrum Team requires it.

questions.question_text:
Peter, a Project Manager, has raised concerns about your Scrum Team's productivity and progress towards the objectives.
Which is the best way to respond to Peter's concerns?
questions.answer_description: One of the key pillars that support the empirical process control is Transparency. Transparency will help manage stakeholder expectations and allow the teams to effectively adapt if and when needed.

choices.A: Share the Product Backlog, the projections towards the release dates and ensure that Peter has access.
choices.D: Share the last stakeholder status report prepared by the Scrum Master.

discussion.content: The answer revolves around "Transparency". Ensuring the access to "Product backlog" and sharing the progress assures the relevant stakeholders have update information on the progress.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

comments.content: Because the developers are responsible for managing sprint impediments and in the review they will cover their progress.
